definition: itinerary/route/political line (e.g. right revisionist road)/CL:條|条[tiao2]
thread/string/wire/line/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3],根[gen1]/(after a number) tier (unofficial ranking of a Chinese city)
the mass line, CCP term for Party policy aimed at broadening and cultivating contacts with the masses

sentences.english: A valuable road map for understanding and healing cybersex addictions.
sentences.chinese: 一个网络性爱的理解和治疗吸毒成瘾宝贵的路线图。

sentences.english: The route and experiments for synthesis of carbazole violet are described in detail.
sentences.chinese: 详细介绍了咔唑紫的合成路线及实验过程。

sentences.english: Alliance flight path between Booty Bay and Stormwind goes through a tree.
sentences.chinese: 联盟从藏宝海湾到暴风城的飞行路线会穿越一棵树。

sentences.english: Opinions on bombing the Serbs cut across party lines.
sentences.chinese: 关于轰炸塞尔维亚的意见违反了党的路线。

sentences.english: The structure of his mental perambulations also seems to have changed.
sentences.chinese: 他的思维漫游的路线似乎也发生了变化。

sentences.english: Three emergency evacuation route arrangement, Lin field mother but need someone to pick up from home.
sentences.chinese: 三林紧急安排撤退路线，但需有人将田母从家中接出。

sentences.english: You'll need to scout ahead to make sure Basso's route is safe.
sentences.chinese: 你需要在前面侦察，确认巴索要走的路线是安全的。

sentences.english: He lined out the route for the sightseers.
sentences.chinese: 他给游客们画出了路线图。

sentences.english: What's the future road map of Tasktop product?
sentences.chinese: Tasktop产品未来的路线图如何？

sentences.english: Staying comfortably in the middle of the crowd also cannot guarantee that one is on the right path.
sentences.chinese: 无风无浪的中间路线也不见得会是正途。
星巴克以走低端路线回应。

sentences.english: The new trolleybus line was routed through the commercial district.
sentences.chinese: 新的无轨电车路线规定要通过商业区。

sentences.english: When completed, the new railway will run for250miles.
sentences.chinese: 完工后，新的铁路线将有250英里长。

sentences.english: Avoid stepping on adversary's ball and altering competitor's line of putt.
sentences.chinese: 在果岭是应避免踏越对方球员的球，及进球路线。

sentences.english: It was time for us to evaluate our roadmap against the technology we were using.
sentences.chinese: 现在是时候对我们使用的技术路线图作一个评估了。

sentences.english: It is not known who hung this quickdraw or when it was hung.
sentences.chinese: 我们不知道是谁以及何时把这把快挂留在这条路线上。

definition: to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)
to make a detour/to take the long route
ring road/circle line (e.g. rail or subway)
journey/course of a journey/distance traveled/trajectory/itinerary/route/course (of history)/stroke (of a piston)/(Tw) (computing) process
direction/strike (i.e. angle of inclination in geology)/inclination/trend/to move towards/to head for
along/to follow (a line, tradition etc)/to carry on/to trim (a border with braid, tape etc)/border/edge
the whole journey/all the way/going the same way/going in the same direction/of the same kind
